Information :

Carbonara is a classic Italian pasta dish that is made with spaghetti or other long pasta, eggs, cheese, and bacon or pancetta. The dish originated in the Lazio region of Italy and is now enjoyed around the world. To make carbonara, spaghetti is cooked until al dente and then tossed with a mixture of beaten eggs, grated parmesan cheese, and black pepper. Cooked bacon or pancetta is then added to the pasta and egg mixture, and everything is tossed together until the cheese and eggs create a creamy sauce. The key to making a good carbonara is to temper the eggs with hot pasta water, so that they don't scramble when they are added to the hot pasta. This creates a smooth, silky sauce that coats the pasta. There are many variations of carbonara, with some recipes calling for the addition of cream or other ingredients. However, traditional carbonara does not contain cream, as the sauce is meant to be created solely from the eggs and cheese. Carbonara is a rich and flavorful dish that is typically served as a main course. It can be paired with a simple green salad and a glass of white wine for a classic Italian meal.

Ingredients :

  • 250 grams Spaghetti
  • 3/4 cup crispy bacon bits
  • 6 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 packet NESTLÉ® All Purpose Cream, 250mL
  • 4 tablespoons melting cheese, grated
  • 1 sachet MAGGI® Magic Sarap® 8g
  • 1/8 teaspoon freshly ground pepper

Instructions :

  • Boil pasta according to package direction. (10 minutes)
  • Cook bacon in a pan to render fat. Strain bacon bits and set aside. (5 minutes)
  • Sauté garlic in the same pan. Pour water and NESTLÉ® All Purpose Cream. Stir in cheese and simmer. Season with MAGGI® Magic Sarap® and pepper. (10 minutes)
  • Strain spaghetti and toss in the sauce. Transfer on a serving plate and top with bacon bits. Serve immediately. (5 minutes)
